abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            and project sustainability is rated as likely. World Bank
            performance and Borrower performance are both rated as
            overall satisfactory. The Borrower met its main
            responsibility to effectively monitor consultants and
            utilize their services to carry out a successful reform
            program. Lessons learned include the following: The success
            of a Technical Assistance Creidit will be enhanced to the
            extent that it is directly tied into a Structural adjustment
            Operation. The IBTA Credit laid the groundwork necessary for
            the SAC by identifying the policy areas; the Terms of
            Reference for IBTA Credit activities were directly related
            to the conditions under the SAC; and the IBTA Credit
            provided capacity building and technical assistance for
            implementation of SAC. In a post-conflict environment, a
            Technical Assistance Credit can be effective under key
            conditions. These conditions include: 1) a general readiness
            by the government to undertake reform; 2) deep country
            knowledge by the task team which is embodied in project
            design; 3) intensive supervision by experienced Bank staff
            in new member countries; and 4) a dedicated Project
            Implementation Unit that is in continuous contact with
            consultants, beneficiary agencies, and the World Bank
            supervision team.
